{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

It would be nice to be able to turn off the ability to customise dashboards for certain groups and/or different dashboards. That way certain groups could have a default dashboard that can't be edited but in JIRA Enterprise, they could add another dashboard that they could edit but not be able to edit the default dashboard. 

Also, certain groups could edit the default dashboard where as other users could not.
fields.summary: Turn off dashboard customisability for different groups and/or different dashboards
Visual Intercept Importer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8679].
  {panel}

It is sometimes desirable to consider a group of issues together, and be able to see their overall status, eg.:

 - A progress bar indicating overall completedness (like subtasks).
 - Aggregated time tracking info
 - Perhaps some way of bulk changing all grouped issues.

For example, it might be handy to show all issues affecting one customer.  Or our issues might be tracking proposed changes, and we want to group them into a 'change request' to all be done at once.
fields.summary: Managing groups of issues (eg. Change Requests)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8671].
  {panel}

I have created a project and assigned a lead. We have created a component within the project. 

Currently when people are logging Jiras they can select either "Unknown" or "my new component". 
I have assigned the "my new component" to myself. 
So if someone selects this component I will get the issue assigned to me. 
I can change all components so that I am the lead. 

BUT 

If someone logging the Jira selects "unknown" the jira is then assigned to the default assignee (which is not me). 
How can I change this so that I get all new jiras directly assigned to me.

Regards
Colm
fields.summary: Modify the "Default Assignee" which is project lead

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 23rd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to reiterate that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

\\

It would be nice if a component could be shared between projects. This way it would be possible to search for issues across projects and specify a component and produce stats cross project that are easier to read.
fields.summary: Ability to share components between projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8619].
  {panel}

One of my collegues pointed out to me that he uses about 3 different column layouts for his 20+ saved filters.
It would be great if one could store the column layout and assign it to filters specifically.
Therefor, a change in a column layout would only require change in one spot, not in 10 or so filters.
Is this already possible?
Thanks, Peter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8586].
  {panel}

The roadmap currently displays the 'Next 3 Unreleased' versions after the currently released version.

It would be useful to also have a link to display the 'Latest 3 Unreleased' versions - i.e. the last versions added to the system.

For example, 1.0 is released. 1.0.1, 1.0.2 1.0.3 are displayed in the 'Next 3 Unreleased' roadmap.
2.0, 2.0.1 and 2.0.2 would be displayed in the 'Latest 3 Unreleased' versions.
fields.summary: Provide 'Latest 3 Versions' link on Roadmap.
CSV Export from the issue navigator
Automatically watch when voting on an issue
Status: Ability to delete default status not possible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8550].
  {panel}

Permission Scheme has various actions for which it is possible to assign action permissions for specific users and/or groups.

For  "Resolve Issues" permission, the explanation is as follows : Ability to resolve and reopen issues. 

But what if, I wish to separata them? I mean I have specific case where resolve permission should be allowed to a specific group whilst reopen permission be allowed to another one...(Resolve by the designated support engineer, but Reopen by ONLY the customer)

Brief, Reopen permission is better to be provided as a separate permission level.

Hope this separation be provided soon.

Thanks
Kamil
fields.summary: Separation of Resolve and Reopen Permissions
The AddComment for Jelly needs to be safer about how it sets the created date on the Comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8530].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an admin, I would like users to have the ability to customize their a default project for creating issues from non project areas of JIRA to avoid them accidentally creating issues in the wrong projects.  
h3. Suggested Solution
The user should be able to set a default project in their profile. 
When the user clicks the Create button and they are not on a project view, for example, when viewing a global board, the create issue project type changes to their default setting. 
h3. Workaround 
Ask the users to change or check the project type when they create the issue.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would my users to have a "Create New Issue" default project setting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8529].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 26 August 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this feature request.

This feature suggestion is in line with our plans for redesign of Project navigation in JIRA: in regards to project related pages (versions, components, reports), but also filters and Summary Page. We are currently discussing the possibilities and analysing the use cases outlined by our customers. Please be vocal in the comments section below - this will help us enormously. And stay tuned for the changes related to navigation.

Unfortunately at this point in time we are not able to share any planned delivery dates.

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
*Original request description:*

Ability to customize "Browse Project" page same as Home page... especially for adding "Assigned to Me", "In Progress", "Project Statistics" and user-definable filters.
\\

Some ideas from the linked duplicate issues:

*JRA-9269*
The dashboard can quickly get cluttered up when there are several projects going on, everyone want their graphs and charts, tables etc. on the dashboard. While some of the "multiple-dashboards" proposals address this more or less (e.g. by allowing saving/loading/sharing of dashboards), I think a project-specific dashboard, controlled by the project lead and viewable by anyone whose permissions allow them to view the project, would be helpful. It would show up as a tab in the 'browse project' set. There may be filters that the particular group likes to use, just for their project, graphs they want to see, handy portlets for the project processes, etc. without losing the view of the 'main' dashboard(s).

Example: The 'preset filters' on the current page are somewhat limited, and there is no way to tweak them and have the tweaked version show up in the project page. So they end up in the big global filter bucket on the main dashboard, where other project members who don't need them are forced to deal with them.

Example: A project lead wants the team to see a burndown chart, time-tracking, or one of the new jfreechart created/resolved charts on the project page.
The ability to customize/add portlets to the existing 'open issues' tab would be useful as well.

*JRA-11604*
Since JIRA 3.7 it is possible to add preset filters on the Browse Project page by creating a Web Fragment plugin.
It would be great if this was also possible just by using JIRA's UI

*JRA-13191*
*Problem*
We need an ease way to change "Preset Filters" on the Browse Project page.
We also need to be able to change what columns to show, the order of the columns and the sorting of the issues.

*Current "solution"*
We know it is possible to change "Preset Filters" with Web Fragment plugins. *But* it is a lot of work - it requires a java programmer - and it is not possible to select/reorder columns.

*Suggested solution*
Under "Share Current Filter" it should be possible to select "Show in Preset Filters for Browse Project". 
Current "Preset Filters" should also be shown here, so it is possible to customise them.

*Other suggestions*
When searching/filtering, it should be possible to search for "current project" (if a project is currently chosen) - just as you can search for "current user" - it would make reuse of filters much simpler.

*Additional benefits*
With this solution it would be possible to use "Preset filers" in "Single Level Group By Report" as requested in JRA-12440 and JRA-8811.

*Other related issues*
JRA-8375 Allow Global saved filters to be used as a preset filter on the Browse Project page
JRA-1639 Merge saved/global filters with "preset filters"
JRA-11604 Allow to create/modify/remove preset filters on the Browse Project page through the web
JRA-10942 Allow 'Preset Filters' in 'browse project' and 'project portlets' to have pluggable

*JRA-22237*
When browsing a project, users are currently presented with a default set of filters on each of the project tabs. For example, on the Summary tab, there are Issues Due, Issues 30 Day Summary, Activity Stream, Issues Updated Recently, etc.; and on the Issues tab, there are Unresolved by Priority, Unresolved by Assignee, Status Summary, etc. These filters are the defaults, as programmed by Atlassian, and can't easily be changed.

I think it would be a very useful improvement to allow either the JIRA administrator or the individual project administrator to choose which filters to display and which filters to hide on each of the project panel tabs. They should be able to choose from a list of standard filters, but should also be able to easily create new filters to include (for example) custom fields. It should not require a programmer to do this.

Example A: the JIRA admin might configure the system so that on ALL projects, the Summary tab will display Issues Closed Recently instead of Issues Updated Recently.
Example B: on one particular project, the project admin might configure it so that the Issues tab will show Unresolved Issues by Type instead of Unresolved by Component, and Unresolved Issues by Severity (a custom field).
fields.summary: Ability to customize "Browse Project" page same as Home page

fields.description: Put drop-downs directly on the task's page which allow reassigning and reprioritizing of task without having to edit it.
fields.summary: Direct drop-downs on task page to change priority and assignee rather than having to edit task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8521].
  {panel}

It became a best practice to define a feature request, improvements etc. as a parent issue and
to break down the implementation tech details into sub-tasks.

Unfortunately, {color:red} *everybody* {color} with permission *_Create_ _Issues_* is able to create *_sub-tasks_*.

There is no way  :( for project lead to enforce a 

* "How to create a sub-task" policy

It's very time *time-consuming* to review every issue and to decide the right type (parent or sub-task).
This leads to all the feature requests like JRA-5410, JRA-5617 and JRA-5869.

My improvement request: please add a {color:green} *new permission type* {color}

* *Create Sub-Tasks*

Based on this improvement, a project lead will be able decide whom to give the permission
to create sub-tasks (e.g. to experienced team members), and not give (e.g. customers, etc.)

And together with JRA-5410 and JRA-5617, it becomes a wonderful housekeeping toolset :) for pro project leads.

----
BTW, please consider to rename *sub-task* to *sub-issues* to become more consistent - check JRA-6923.
fields.summary: Add permission type  Create Sub-Tasks ( better: Create Sub-Issues )

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8514].
  {panel}

From a [jira-user post|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257221267&#257221267]:

{quote}
The guys here have grumbled quite a bit about the inability of Jira (out
of the box) to notify people when other tasks they are blocking become
resolved. I was thinking last night about this (hey shouldn't it be just
the Jira developers who dream about it?!) and was reminded of a simple
solution I've thought of before:

Add a notification event for "Linked Issue Resolved", and a new
notification target grouping "Assignees of all linked issues"

This event would be triggered when any issue that is inwardly linked
(linked TO by other issues) is resolved, and notifications, if setup
usign the new notification grouping, would be sent to all Assignees of
the inwardly linking issues. Hey presto you find out when issues you
depend on are fixed.

This is loosely related to some of the ideas in:

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-2678
{quote}
fields.summary: New "Linked Issue Resolved" notification type
Add a new "Issue Linked" event for listeners to respond to

fields.description:
User feedback:

# Sensitive to extra space between time and AM/PM. Users routinely make the error of typing in extra spaces here - we need to regex-trim spaces between items in format (repalceAll(" +" ," ") ).
+This is the main thing we want fixed+
# The shift/click/drag method of setting the time in the DHTML widget is a bit of a PITA (issue with the calender itself rather than jira treatment of results)
# You seem to be able to put in 19:35 AM (seems to think that is valid)
# 24 hr format support would be nice
# Timezone support would be _nice_ (but we may do this as a custom field for this)
fields.summary: Aspects of the DateTime Calendar widget are a little clunky - esp setting the time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8497].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently JIRA allows all users to clone issues. As a JIRA Administrator, I'd like to restrict the ability to Clone issues to certain groups only. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a *Clone Issues* permission to Permission Schemes.
 
h3. Original Description
{quote}
The "Clone this issue" link doesn't mean anything to most of our users, so it would be nice to be able to remove this link.  It should be another permission in the Permission Schemes screen (like the "Link Issues" permission)
{quote}

h3. Workaround

Use the property *jira.permission.createclone.denied* in each status of the workflow and set the value to *true*, it should work.
 !Screen Shot 2020-03-27 at 08.30.05.png|thumbnail!   !Screen Shot 2020-03-27 at 08.24.36.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2020-03-27 at 08.24.46.png|thumbnail! 

(i) This process disables *Clone* as well as *Split* operation.
fields.summary: Ability to disable "Clone Issue" link per project
Ask confirmation before returning to previous page after changes
Work artifact library implementation - does/can Jira support a list of project deliverables that can be referenced by issues?
Check if incoming email subject matches any issue summaries to determine if they are comments

I created new workflow, a copy of jira's bundled one, just to glue two of the functions
resolve and close, i made "resolve and close" transition, it works fine if the issue is open,
but i found impossible to make the same transition for "in progress" step. It seems 
unpossible to add a post-function "fire event 'work on issue stopped'"
fields.summary: Glue "stop progress" "resolve" and "close" in one transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8441].
  {panel}

JIRA is becoming easier to use with the keyboard each day and one of the things I do now is {{Preview}} for my wiki markup.

It would be nice to have an accesskey associated with this feature, say {{*Alt + P*}}.

h4. How will it work?

Functionally, if you're *focussed* on a Wiki enabled text area, pressing Alt+P will flip the area to a preview. Another Alt+P will toggle it back to the text area and focus in on it. Once you leave the wiki enabled field, Alt+P should do nothing. 

Once you focus in on a wiki field again, the whole cycle also begins again.

This will only work for the last previewed field, so it won't work for the seconf last field if you have two fields being simultaneously previewed.

h4. The pseudocode

have a {{onfocus}} handler that adds an accesskey=P on the preview link and and {{onblur}} that removes it. That might be the easiest solution if it works. You will have to track the "lastPreviewed" field but other than that, it should be okay.

h4. Wil this actually work?

I have no idea :) Adding dynamic accesskey property works in theory but I've never tried it.  If the dynamic accesskey doesn't work, then we can add key listeners (we already do this for textareas anyway) to make this work.
fields.summary: Shortcut key for wiki preview
Filter Sharing Permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8428].
  {panel}

If a tag name contains a control character like ^M, then JIRA's CVS log parser will break with an error:

{noformat}
Error occurred while obtaining cvs or parsing the cvs log.
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1
        at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1444)
        at
net.sf.statcvs.input.CvsFileBlockParser.parseSymbolicNames(CvsFileBlockP
arser.java:189)
        at
net.sf.statcvs.input.CvsFileBlockParser.parse(CvsFileBlockParser.java:93
)
        at
net.sf.statcvs.input.CvsLogfileParser.parse(CvsLogfileParser.java:84)
        at
com.atlassian.jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl.parseCvsLogs(CvsRep
ositoryUtilImpl.java:153)
        at
com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.vcs.RepositoryActionSupport.testRepo
sitory(RepositoryActionSupport.java:285)
        at
com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.vcs.RepositoryTest.doExecute(Reposit
oryTest.java:68)
{noformat}

Attached is a sample CVS log which demonstrates this problem.
fields.summary: CVS parsing breaks when tag contains control character:  java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -1

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8418].
  {panel}

If a user:
 - does not check "Remember me"
 - fills in the issue creation form
 - leaves the computer for an hour
 - returns to the computer and clicks 'Submit'

then they are likely to get a confusing permission error, because they are not logged in anymore. If anonymous issue submission is allowed, the issue may be submitted anonymously, which is not what is wanted.

Ideally JIRA would detect that the session is expired, save the current form data (in a new session's attribute), redirect them to the login page and return to CreateIssueDetails.jspa without losing any of the previously entered data.
fields.summary: Permission errors when session times out halfway through creating an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8413].
  {panel}

Our project is in the process of evaluating JIRA (BTW: Great product) and have a question about if the following is possible.

Is it possible to create a group of fields on an issue that are repeatable? I'm looking at a screen with 5 or 6 different fields on it and a user can fill in the fields, click add and add more if needed. Probably the best example within Jira I see of this is the View Screen Schemes page where you can add as many schemes as you want. Is it possible to add such functionality for an issue?

I don't think this is possible OOB and will require custom code, but wanted to ask the JIRA community about it.

Thanks
-Jeff
fields.summary: Ability to add group of repeating fields in an issue

When using national characters in reporters or assignees, the sorting doesn't work, as I suggested. The names with national characters are pushed to end of list, that is wrong.

Current bahaviour - sorting by reporter:

* Lízner Lukáš
* Novák Karel
* Zima Oldřich
* Čedík Pavel
* Šaršon Jindřich

Correct behaviour with correct czech ordering should be:

* Čedík Pavel
* Lízner Lukáš
* Novák Karel
* Šaršon Jindřich
* Zima Oldřich

I suggest to create new field in admin, where I be able to specify, which locales I want to use for sorting, as Collator class do.
fields.summary: Sorting in issue list doesn't respect locale settings

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Hi,

in our workflow, there's a validation step after creating and before resolving. 1. open, 2. valid, 3.in progress,...
It will be interesting to avoid this step for the users who don't need to be valid :
a validation for the customers, not for the actors of the projects...

It could be a post-function which transform the status open in valid if the actor of the transition belongs to leader, developers,...

Is-it possible to do something like that or what do you recommend?

Thank's

Anne

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8286].
  {panel}

We had the partition which is used for Jira's indexes become full for about 10 minutes. During this time, Jira couldn't obviously correctly update the indexes which caused the indexes to go out of synch.

The issue here is that Jira continued to seem to run fine although it for example wasn't showing any new issues in return to filter queries due to the index problem.

Rebuilding the index corrected the issue.

Could you look into creating some form of a "dirty flag" for the index and set it in case the indexer has trouble saving the index files? Then notify the administrators somehow that there was trouble saving the index and ask them to rebuild.
fields.summary: Index corruption when server drives get full - Jira doesn't notice

fields.description:
It seems that unless we narrow the issue navigator filter to a specific issue type, we dont see custom field columns associated with those issues.

We have some projects which only have 1 valid issue type (the rest are ignored - and in fact we have a custom "invalid issue type" message field for those issue types. So it means that all the filters - dont show the necessary custom fields....
fields.summary: Issue Navigator columns dont appear for issue-type-specific custom fields
update an "user custom field" with the logged user value in the postfunction of a transition

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8262].
  {panel}

We have Confluence, we have Jira.
No matter how I poke around with the settings in JIRA, the look does not match Confluence (unless I use the default settings).
When I apply our color scheme, I still have various blue elements on screen.
Please unify the settings (and underlying markup) so that it is possible to use them in a consistent look wihtout having to touch most of the templates.
fields.summary: Please consolidate "look&feel" settings (color scheme) and unify with Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8236].
  {panel}

Please parse reply emails and remove Jira history content. Something like: if the email subject contains a Jira project key
then look at the content and delete anything below the first email header that contains that key.

We use Jira to track field issues and provide field support. 
1. Field staffer creates a Jira issue (either directly or via email). 
2. Support staff in head office make a comment in Jira. 
3. Field staffer receives a notification email containing the comment. 
5. Field staffer then typically replies "with history". 
6. Their reply with all of its history is added as one Jira comment, but that same history is already tracked (in a much nicer way) through individual Jira comments. This adds accumulated redundant information for each emailed reply "with history". After only a few replies such a Jira issue is very difficult to read, to the point of being counter-productive.

Field staff prefer email over Jira web access because they travel alot and don't always have access to the internet. But they do have access to a local replica of their email database on their laptops. This means they can work offline and respond to our questions straight after leaving a customer site (on a plane or train) while vital new information is fresh.

We have asked field staff to reply "without history" but this never works. They want to see what they're replying to and they always want to cc other staff in regional offices who have more access to internet and can "watch" issues.
fields.summary: Remove previous Jira history from the content of incoming emails (which are replies to Jira notifications)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8235].

I think this user should be notified about this action that he has access to the JIRA.
Thank you

Vladimír Skrbek
Česká spořitelna, a.s.
Testovací kompetenční centrum
Želetavská 1448/7, Praha4, 140 00
tel. +420 225 661 055
fields.summary: send email (without password) to new user even if it is from LDAP

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8229].
  {panel}

We'd really like to accelerate the creation of "template" issues containing a standard set of sub-task "steps". Ie: this template here:

Task
   Concept Sketch
   Model
   Normal Map
   Skin
 
Would be done 50-100x, once for each art asset we're tracking. We have the high-level list and I want to accelerate the creation of these issues with their steps as sub-tasks. I was looking into doing this with Jelly tags (I can perl some XML that would describe what we want but I can't express "sub-task" with the existing set of jelly commands.
fields.summary: Enable Creation of Sub-Tasks via Jelly Tags

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8227].
  {panel}


The specific scenario I had in mind is :
we have a project with many users being assignable (~300)
They belong to about 10 or so groups

We could realy do with either a cascade select, or an ajax narrow as you type solution.

Oh and BTW Love these wiki edit boxes...
fields.summary: Make user select a group/user cascade select for large number of users
User Picker too small
Tasklist macro for Wiki text
Ensure user-edited files have DOS linefeeds in ZIP distribution

fields.description:
How can our customer search for "not empty" (custom) fields without searching a particular search term/ phrase? 
The content/ value of the field is irrelevant - we want to search for issues where a particular field is filled in at all.

Our customer's main problem is the following:
How can we filter all Standard Issue Types (or Sub-Task Issue Types), which already have an Original Estimate?

But there are other scenarios (with custom fields involved) where we miss the possibility of searching for fields "that are not empty"
(a) find all issues where there is any "Fixed in Build" (Text Field (< 255 characters) with Free Text Searcher) 
(b) find all issues which already have a "Release Note" (Free Text Field (unlimited text) with Free Text Searcher)
fields.summary: Search/ filter for "not empty" (custom) fields
Stack Trace macro
Allow all Confluence macros/plugins in JIRA markup
Status field should be able to reflect status of sub-tasks
Allow help tips for custom fields - alt text and pop-ups
Custom project attributes
No Priority comes before Blocker Priority
Current release attribute
Multi Select custom field sorts only on the first selected option.
Custom field showing how long an issue has been open
Mechanism to control automatic screen refresh on filters.
Show disabled users with striked through names

fields.description:
(a) When viewing the results of a filter on a portal page via 2-dim. filter statistics, for the system field 'Issue Type' 
not only the ICON is visible, but the NAME of the issue type is available, too.

(b) When viewing the results of a filter in the issue navigator, information on the system field 'Issue Type' is ONLY available as ICON. 

As we use approximately 20 different sub-task types, there's no use in having a different icon for each sub-task type. 
So they all have the same icon. JIRA-behaviour (b) makes it impossible to distinguish - at a glance - between different 
sub-task in a list in the issue navigator. See attachment.

Can this be changed at all? If yes, how?
fields.summary: System Field: Issue Type - only icon is displayed in issue navigator

fields.description: Say anyone in JIRA is potentially an assignee ('Assignable User' permission is granted to 'jira-user'). This results in a potentially massive list of people, for which the assignee select-list is an inappropriate mechanism for selecting one.  It would be nice if JIRA knew how many potential assignees there are, and present either a select-list, or a user search interface, depending on the number of issues.
fields.summary: When assigning from large list of users, provide search interface instead of drop-down

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8095].
  {panel}

Hi,

First off, great product and thanks again for the open source licensing for the Australian Biological Information Facility (ABIF) portal project.

It seems that there are two types of links which every installation should use if they use issue linking: duplicates and dependency. I would vote that they are made standard links which every installation has (and are undeletable).

If that was the case, you would be able to more easily build standard functionality on them. Some of this functionality might include:
- Gantt charts, displaying dependencies between issues.
- Dependency change notification (I'll elaborate on that).

I think this is a natural progression in the direction the application is already moving in. It feels like 90% of the work for this kind of stuff is done and the application could soon start creating some of those really awesome bonus features (like Gantt charts).

Dependency change notification: If an issue is marked as "depending" on another, you could set up a default "watch" action. If the issue which was the prerequisite had a status change, JIRA could then send an email to the person assigned to that issue.
fields.summary: Make link types for "Dependency" and "Duplicate" standard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8092].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days.

We are certainly working to make JIRA more flexible on a per-project basis so that it's easier for a variety of teams to adapt it. Voting and watching certainly fall under this category. While this issue is not currently on our roadmap, we do hope to address this in the future.

Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  
There should be a project permission to restrict which users can vote or watch for an issue.
fields.summary: Voting and Watching Permission
limit number of links of a certain type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8090].
  {panel}

The getIssuesFromFilter() function returns entire bugs with all history, comments, etc. This is fine on a LAN but over the internet doing simple things like getting a list of the summaries for all bugs assigned to Joe is very slow and bandwidth-consuming.

My suggestion is to modify the function, or provide an overload or new function that lets me customize what will get returned. Perhaps a simple array of field names to return would work. Then I could ignore fields that I don't need anyway that are large to transfer in SOAP.

The brass ring would be to add a "cursor" feature that lets me do a query then iterate through the issues in chunks, rather than getting them all at once in a big pile (similar to how the issue navigator lets me go a page at a time).


Original email conversation follows:

Hi Scott,

 > I admit the "count" feature is something that is too specific to be
 > useful to a lot of people. So instead of returning counts, what about
 > accepting more arguments in getIssuesFromFilter() that let us choose
 > which fields are returned? Returning them all as it does now is very
 > painful when using Jira from remote.

I can see that this will be useful. You are more than welcome to create 
a new feature request on http://jira.atalssian.com. Please note however 
that it might take us some time to get to this feature as we have *a 
lot* of  feature requests. The way we implement new features and 
improvements is described here:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Implementation+of+New+Features+and+Improvements

 > How does Confluence do this btw for its macros that show the top 10
 > issues? As far as I know, Conf talks to Jira via an RPC method. If a
 > filter has 200 items in it, does Conf end up downloading all 200 items
 > in full, just to show the summaries and bug numbers for 10 of

Confluence HTML grabs (sort of "screen grabs") the results of a JIRA 
portlet from JIRA by posting ot the RunPortlet URL. For example:
http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/RunPortlet.jspa?portletKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.portlets:filterstats&filterid=12265&statistictype=assignees&

The URL for each portlet can be obtained by turning "Configure" on, on 
the dashboard and looking at link of portlet's name.

Alternatively Confluence fetches the RSS view of a filter from JIRA and 
then displays it:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/navigatorviews.html

Thanks,
Anton


Scott Bilas wrote:
> I admit the "count" feature is something that is too specific to be
> useful to a lot of people. So instead of returning counts, what about
> accepting more arguments in getIssuesFromFilter() that let us choose
> which fields are returned? Returning them all as it does now is very
> painful when using Jira from remote.
> 
> How does Confluence do this btw for its macros that show the top 10
> issues? As far as I know, Conf talks to Jira via an RPC method. If a
> filter has 200 items in it, does Conf end up downloading all 200 items
> in full, just to show the summaries and bug numbers for 10 of them?
> 
> Scott
> 
> 
> Nick Menere <mailto:nick.menere@atlassian.com> wrote on Monday,
> September 05, 2005 11:15 PM:
> 
> 
>>Hi Scott,
>>
>>Our SOAP interface doesn't really support anything like that.  Though
>>it is possible to extend the SOAP interface using the XML/RPC pugin:
>>http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/RPC+Endpoint+Plug
>>in+Module 
>>
>>You also have access to our source if you wish to make modifications
>>to the current methods.
>>
>>Cheers,
>>Nick
>>
>>
>>
>>Scott Bilas wrote:
>>
>>>Hi there,
>>>
>>>I'm trying to use Jira's SOAP API to gather current statistics on the
>>>database, similar to how the portlets work, except to post the data
>>>in a different place. Unfortunately getIssues returns all the data
>>>for each bug, where I pretty much just want counts of the number of
>>>elements in a query, or the short summaries of each bug (not the
>>>full description with comments, etc.). Is there a way to get this
>>>information from Jira's SOAP API? 
>>>
>>>Scott
> 
>
fields.summary: Request to customize returns from getIssuesFromFilter() RPC

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8081].
  {panel}

{panel:title=22nd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. There a couple add-ons on the Atlassian Marketplace that can support this, such as [Configuration Manager for JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.botronsoft.jira.configurationmanager]. Alternatively, this is very easy to do with a simple GET of the component you want to copy and a POST of the components JSON representation to the JIRA REST API, simply change the project key and id in the rep.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

This issue is related to JRE-501 (Shared Components) and JRE-6999 (Add ability to export/import projects):

We need a way to copy components from one project to another. This is because the projects have _nearly_ the same components.

There are several ways how this issue might be solved from my point of view:

1. There might be an ex- and import of project-components.
2. There might be a button in the Projects-Administration to copy a project.
3. Upon creation of a new project you are asked if to take components from an existing project (and perhaps other settings, too)

Now the reason why we require this:

In contrast to perhaps the normal application-development we had to create projects for each release-version of the same application. This is because after a version is released it will go into maintenance-mode thus the version is never really finished. See for example a release history like this:

January V 1.0 build 1 Final-Release (Components: A, B, C)
February V 1.1 build 1 Final-Release (Components: A, C)
March V 1.0 build 2 Bugfix-Release
April V2.0 build 1 Final-Release  (Components: A, C, D)
May V1.1 build 2 Bugfix-Release

and so on. Therefore virtually we have a new project/product with every Final-Release. It's rather hard to mirror this pre-existing handling of versions inside JIRA as the "normal" version-concept included into JIRA does not fit. So the application-versions are now projects while the JIRA-version-field is related to the build-numbers.

To use our workaround we now have to copy all components from one project to another. Resolving this issue would ease to handle this workaround.
fields.summary: Add a feature to copy/paste components between projects
Add ability to specify the default component in the CreateOrCommentHandler
Filtering on MOVED issues - retrieving issues that are MOVED from one project to another.
Reorganize sub-task order within the parent task
Bulk delete users
Should be able to 'edit' Security Levels
Ability to trigger the service to run now in the UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8023].
  {panel}

Basically, we want to be able to filter on issues on the basis of their SCM information
a) Have some checkins against them (on given branch(es) and commit date constraints)
b) have no checkins against them

We need to do this to find 
a) issue fixes that were not checked into the required branches
b) issues that were checked into the right branches - but the fix version in jira is incorrect or missing
fields.summary: Add Filter  criteria for version control entries

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8022].
  {panel}

In Confluence it is possible to edit a text and check "minor change, no notifications will be sent" to diable e-mail notifications about the change.

This feature would be really helpful in JIRA, to avoid the e-mail "spamming" that exists today, because JIRA cant be configured to e.g. only send mail once a day including all relevant changes.

If one of my customers reports an issue, and i add 10 attachments to the issue. The customer receives 10 e-mails. This is annoying.

If i could check a "minor change, no notifications will be sent" field when

- executing a workflow action
- edition an issue
- creating an attachment
- adding a comment

that would be a great feature.

Of course, there should be a permission allowing this fuctionality. I don't want my customers to be able to edit issues without notifying me.
fields.summary: Minor change, no notifications will be sent
Clone subtask to another parent issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-8000].
  {panel}

we've been hit by spam recently; someone registers and then posts spam to our JIRA. We'd like an easy way to 

(i) find the spammer based on a user name (rather than email) as we've zillions of users and can't find their user account to delete it.

(ii) a way to delete all comments from that user with one click.

To see the spam, click here...

http://www.google.com/search?client=safari&rls=en-gb&q=massagelondon+site:logicblaze.com&ie=UTF-8&oe=UTF-8

e.g. http://jira.logicblaze.com/jira/browse/AMQ-169?page=all&decorator=printable

The user appears as 'massagelondon' but the user name is not clickable for some reason (whereas all others is)
fields.summary: better spam features to zap an offending user along with all their comments
UpdateIssueFieldFunction uses current users permission for validation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-7998].
  {panel}

ProjectDelete calls removeProjectPortlets once for each search request in a project.

removeProjectPortlets then inefficiently makes database calls to get propertyStrings.
For the Jira project (if we wanted to delete it) there would be roughly 40 000 calls to delegator.findByPrimaryKey().

Takes up roughly 50% of time for Project Deletion.
fields.summary: Make project deletion more efficient - reduce database calls
Support for specifying location for storing attachments on a per-category/project basis
